title: Document Description
description: Details about source objects in terms of the ontology.  STATUS: ready for review

DocumentObject.title: Document Object Description
DocumentObject.description: Description for a document object; a unique identifier, location information, and ontology descriptors.

descriptors.title: Descriptor List
descriptors.description: List of descriptors assigned to this object.  The list of descriptors must not contain multiple items with the same key, and the values for the key must conform to the document's ontology.

DocumentDescriptor.title: Document Descriptor
DocumentDescriptor.description: The ontological descriptor key and associated value.

values.title: Descriptor Value List
values.description: The descriptor values.  Each entry must conform to the descriptor key's value types.

DescriptorKey.title: Descriptor Key
DescriptorKey.description: Unique identifier for the descriptor. (Taken from the ontology schema)

DescriptorTextValue.title: Descriptor Text Value
DescriptorTextValue.description: A textual value, either an enumerated or free value.

Id.title: Unique Identifier
Id.description: Unique identifying string for the item.  These should be ASCII alpha-numeric + simple separators.

CommonDocumentSourceList.title: Common Document Source List
CommonDocumentSourceList.description: Pool of document source references, which may be referenced from the source locations.

CommonDocumentSource.title: Common Document Source
CommonDocumentSource.description: A shared primary document reference.  Source locations can refer to this document through the identifier, but should also include an anchor.

rep.title: Repository Category
rep.description: General repository category containing the source.  This might be 'git' if stored in a Git repository, or 'aws-s3', if stored in an Amazon S3 key store, or 'intranet' if stored in an Intranet source.  The different programs may have their own requirements for this value.  It does not define a location within the repository, though.

loc.title: Source Resource
loc.description: The resource identifier within the 'repo'.  Depending on the repo type, this most likely has a required format for that repository.

ver.title: Version
ver.description: An identifier to reference the unique version of the source, as dictated by the repository type.  This might a commit id, or document revision, or a date-time stamp.  The repository type may not have the ability to retrieve this version (someone may have deleted it, or the repository does not support versioning).

DocumentSources.title: Document Sources
DocumentSources.description: Sources that contained the original definitions.  A tool collected those descriptions into this document.

SourceLocation.title: Source Location
SourceLocation.description: Pointer to the location of the source.  Due to the prevalence of this object, property names use a truncated form to shrink file sizes.  The 'ref' points to a common document source identifier in the commonSourceRefs list.

a.title: Anchor
a.description: A location within the source.  This depends upon the source type; it might be an HTML anchor tag, or a paragraph title, or a function name, or a line number, or an opcode index.
